content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the taurage district court the court determined the ownership of several vehicles in a matrimonial property case the defendant was found to be in possession of the cars and the court awarded them to the defendant as their personal property the court also declared that any consumer credit taken by the applicant would be their personal liability the legal text discusses various articles from the civil code related to the termination of a matrimonial community property the applicant is requesting the dissolution of the marriage establishment of residence for their son monthly maintenance benefit payment of maintenance arrear appointment of a trustee for funds awarded to their son reimbursement for a consumer credit approval for a repayment agreement with a third party and division of property the defendant disagrees with the application and claims the applicant is at fault for the dissolution of the marriage the court reviews the evidence and grants the action dissolving the marriage and granting personal ownership of several vehicles to the defendant the court also approves an agreement between the applicant and a third person for repayment of improvements made to an apartment
